newsitem.title: USA: BEFORE THE BELL - Gucci climbs on EPS news.
newsitem.headline: BEFORE THE BELL - Gucci climbs on EPS news.

text.p: Gucci Group NV shares rallied preceding Thursday's U.S. market open, as buyers came in upon learning of the luxury goods company's sharp rise in 1996 fiscal year earnings.
Ahead of the opening bell, Gucci's New York Stock Exchange-listed shares jumped to 76 from 70-7/8, traders said.
Gucci said it earned $2.76 in the year ended January 31 versus $1.68 one year ago. Net revenue climbed to $881 million from $500 million.
Meanwhile, Quaker Oats shares were bid higher, to 38-5/8 from Wednesday's 37-1/2 finish, after Triarc Cos Inc said it will buy Quaker's Snapple unit for $300 million.
Triarc shares were bid at 15-7/8 just after the announcement was made, up from 15-3/4 at last night's NYSE close.
Tech Data Corp shares traded at 25-1/2 before the open, up from 23-7/8.
The company reported fiscal fourth earnings of $0.40 per share last night, $0.01 better than the consensus Wall Street estimate compiled by Zack's Investment Research.
Tech Data, a distributor computer hardware and software, earned $0.24 per share one year ago.
Among other stocks active before the market open, Cisco Systems added 5/8 to 53, Intel climbed to 142-3/8 from 140-5/8, Apple Computer rose one to 17-3/4 and Microsoft was 3/4 better to 95.
